page.title: 16Seaton Church
page.content: The church in Seaton is called All Hallows' Church.The church was built around the 11th or 12th century. It was restored by two sisters called Monkton about 50 years ago. The rector is Rev.A.J.Gough.He lives in Lyddington,two miles away.He doesn't live in Seaton because he is also the vicar of Lyddington. It has a big stained glass window depicting the Resurrection and also a memorial window.By the seats there are little kneelers(made by the women of the village),dedicated to past vicars and rectors. When you go into the porch of the church there is a very valuable chest. The altar is made of marble.On it stand a cross and two candlesticks and there is a coloured altar-frontal.At the side of the altar is a chair called the Bishop's Chair.
